p: Therefore, rapid diagnosis benefits patients in allowing timely therapy to prevent complications; and benefits public health by collecting data for epidemiological studies, to prevent outbreaks and spreading of diseases. In that context, the WHO has established many surveillance programs for disease control such as the global strategy for control and assessment of HIV drug resistance, the Global Influenza Surveillance and Response System for the control and monitoring of Influenza and the Global Policy on Viral Hepatitis.
